etymology.description: Depicts a human eye, now represented and rotated 90 degrees -> eye
etymology.interpretation: The character 目(mù, 'eye') is a pictogram representing a human eye. Its original orientation has changed over time, resembling an eye seen from a sideways view.

examples.chinese: 他的目光炯炯有神(他的目光炯炯有神)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de mùguāng jiǒngjiǒng yǒu shén.
examples.english: His gaze is bright and full of spirit.

examples.chinese: 她目不转睛(她目不轉睛)，注视前方(注視前方)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mù bù zhuǎn jīng, zhùshì qiánfāng.

examples.chinese: 雄鹰展翅(雄鷹展翅)，双目炯炯看天际(雙目炯炯看天際)。
examples.pinyin: Xióng yīng zhǎn chì, shuāng mù jiǒngjiǒng kàn tiānjì.
examples.english: The eagle spreads its wings, its eyes piercingly gaze at the horizon.
